news.title: Statins are safe and potential side-effects have been exaggerated, ...
news.summary: Published: 22:31 GMT, 8 September 2016 | Updated: 22:31 GMT, 8 September 2016 Statins are safe and effective but their potential side-effects have been exaggerated by unreliable studies, according to a major medical review.

news.title: Statins are safe and potential side-effects have been exaggerated, says...
news.summary: Statins, the cholesterol-reducing tablets, are the most prescribed drugs in the UK Statins are safe and effective but their potential side-effects have been exaggerated by unreliable studies, according to a major medical review.

news.title: Statins Are Safe And Negative Side Effects Have Been Overstated, Medical Review Warns

news.title: CLINICAL NEWS: U.K. researchers: Statin risks exaggerated
news.summary: In a review published Friday in The Lancet, U.K. researchers said claims about the side effects of statin therapy have been exaggerated, and expressed concern over reduced statin use to prevent cardiovascular events.

news.title: Statins' benefits outweigh side-effects: science review
news.summary: The heart-protecting benefits of anti-cholesterol statins far outnumber the side-effects, a scientific review said Friday blaming shoddy research for scaring people and putting lives at risk.

news.title: Statins safe and effective, review finds
news.summary: Statins are safe and effective to use and their potential side-effects have been exaggerated by unreliable studies, according to a major medical review.

news.title: Side-Effects Of Statins Dangerously Exaggerated
news.summary: Statins have been declared safe and effective after an exhaustive medical review - with experts warning their potential side-effects have been exaggerated by unreliable studies.

news.title: Side-Effects Of Statins Dangerously Exaggerated, Review Warns
news.summary: Statins have been declared safe and effective after an exhaustive medical review - with experts warning their potential side-effects have been exaggerated by unreliable studies.

news.title: Statins safe and side-effects exaggerated, review finds
news.summary: Statins are safe and effective, and their potential side-effects have been exaggerated by unreliable studies, according to a major medical review.

news.title: Lancet statin review should help end the fear-mongering
news.summary: Australian heart and vascular specialists have hailed a major review on statins published in the Lancet as a benchmark for ending fear-mongering.

news.title: Statins’ benefits understated and their harms exaggerated
news.summary: Preventing a major cardiovascular event by taking statins is much more important than the risks involved.

news.title: The raging statin debate: should you take a cholesterol-lowering drug?
news.summary: If you are over the age of 40, chances are you already pop a cholesterol-lowering pill called a statin.

news.title: Statins prevent 80,000 heart attacks and strokes a year in UK, study finds
news.summary: Statins to lower cholesterol prevent 80,000 heart attacks and strokes every year in the UK, far outweighing the harm from rare side-effects, according to a review of the evidence which aims to put a heated controversy to rest and reassure the public…

news.title: Major review aims to end debate over taking statins
news.summary: Cholesterol-lowering drugs called statins The research, published today in The Lancet, will help doctors and patients make more informed decisions when it comes to using statins, the scientists said in a media briefing.

news.title: Major review aims to end debate over taking statins
news.summary: Cholesterol-lowering drugs called statins? have gotten a bad rap, say the authors of a comprehensive new review of 30 years’ worth of studies on the medications.

news.title: A third of adults should take statins, new research suggests - Independent.ie
news.summary: Published 09/09/2016 | 08:10 The number of people taking statins should double, according to the author of a landmark report which has found that the drug's side effects have been exaggerated and the treatment prevents 80,000 heart attacks a year.

news.title: Benefits Of Statins Largely Underestimated

news.title: Cardiologists hail statin study
news.summary: Leading Australian heart and vascular specialists have hailed a major review on statins published in the Lancet as a benchmark for ending ‘fear-mongering’ about the medication.

news.title: Review Touts Benefits of Statins, Seeks to Dispel Safety Concerns
news.summary: A new review aims to clarify the evidence regarding the safety and efficacy of statins, concluding that the benefits of the drugs in terms of reducing major vascular events far outweigh any proven or potential risks.

news.title: Leaders call for major rethink on NHS
news.summary: A fundamental shift of provision of care from hospitals to the community is central to a radical new vision for how the NHS should be run, published at the weekend.

news.title: Six candidates for WHO Director-General present their visions and priorities
news.summary: News Hour :  Six candidates are running for next Director General of the World Health Organisation (WHO).
